text: Sapienza University of Rome (), also known simply as Sapienzaor the University of Rome, is a research university located in Rome, Italy. Officially known as the Universit√† Studi di Roma "La Sapienza", it is one of the largest universities in Europe by enrollment and one of the oldest in history, founded in 1303. The university is one of the most prestigious universities in Italy and over the world, often ranking first in national and Southern European rankings. In 2018, it ranked the 1st of the world for classical and ancient history. Most of the historical Italian ruling class studied at Sapienza. Sapienza university educated many notable alumni, including multiple Nobel laureates, Presidents of the European Parliament and European Commissioners, heads of state, religious figures, notable astronauts and scientists. In September 2018, it was included in the top 100 of the QS World University Graduate Employability Rankings. == Note == == References == == Other websites == * Sapienza University of Rome Italian Website * Sapienza University of Rome English Website Category:CS1 errors: unsupported parameter Category:Pages using deprecated image syntax Category:Articles containing Latin-language text Category:Articles containing Italian-language text Category:Colleges and universities in Italy Category:14th century in Italy Category:14th-century establishments in Europe
title: Sapienza University of Rome
